get.summary:
Gets memberships for a party for a set of resources/parties.
            


              This is an internal API and requires an administrative token.
Get all access lists for a given resource owner.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: What additional information to include in the response

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description:
Optional resource identifier. Required if include has flag Altinn.ResourceRegistry.Core.AccessLists.AccessListIncludes.ResourceConnections
set. This is used to filter the resource connections included in the access lists to only the provided resource.

put.description: This effectively overwrites all members with the ones included in the request. It should not be used for lists with more than 100 members.

schema.description: Object sent to the API to add/remove/overwrite members from an access list.

Last-Modified.description: The last modified date of the resource

post.summary: Add new members to an access list.
post.description: This method is idempotent, meaning that if a member already exists, it will not be added again.

schema.description: Object sent to the API to add/remove/overwrite members from an access list.

delete.summary: Remove members from an access list if they exist.

get.summary: Returns the XACML policy for a resource in resource registry.

post.summary:
Creates or overwrites the existing XACML policy for the resource, if it pass all validation checks.
The XACML policy must define at least a subject and resource, and will be used to restrict access for the resource.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The resource identifier to store the policy for

put.summary:
Creates or overwrites the existing XACML policy for the resource, if it pass all validation checks.
The XACML policy must define at least a subject and resource, and will be used to restrict access for the resource.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The resource identifier to store the policy for

createdAt.description: When the access list was created

updatedAt.description: When the access list was updated

AccessListMembersContinuationTokenOpaque.description:
An opaque value is a value that can be transmitted to another party
                without divulging any type information or expectations about the value.
            


                Opaque values are typically usefull in APIs where the server wants to
                be able to return a value that the client later needs to send back to
                the server, but where the server does not want to expose the type of
                the value to the client. For instance, in a pagination scenario, the
                server can use an opaque int to do pagination by page number, while
                allowing itself to later change the implementation to use a cursor
                instead of a page number without breaking the API.

since.description: Since when the party has been a member of the access list.

AccessListResourceConnectionContinuation.description:
An opaque value is a value that can be transmitted to another party
                without divulging any type information or expectations about the value.
            


                Opaque values are typically usefull in APIs where the server wants to
                be able to return a value that the client later needs to send back to
                the server, but where the server does not want to expose the type of
                the value to the client. For instance, in a pagination scenario, the
                server can use an opaque int to do pagination by page number, while
                allowing itself to later change the implementation to use a cursor
                instead of a page number without breaking the API.

JsonPointer.description: Represents a JSON Pointer as defined in RFC 6901.

isEmpty.description: Gets weather the segment is empty.

JsonPointer.Segment.description: A segment of a JSON Pointer.

next.description: Link to the next page of items (if any).

StringOpaque.description:
An opaque value is a value that can be transmitted to another party
                without divulging any type information or expectations about the value.
            


                Opaque values are typically usefull in APIs where the server wants to
                be able to return a value that the client later needs to send back to
                the server, but where the server does not want to expose the type of
                the value to the client. For instance, in a pagination scenario, the
                server can use an opaque int to do pagination by page number, while
                allowing itself to later change the implementation to use a cursor
                instead of a page number without breaking the API.

actionFilters.description: The allowed actions - if null or empty, all actions will be allowed.
